channel.title: RDKit on Some Title
channel.description: Recent content in RDKit on Some Title

item.title: What is your Tanimoto coefficient?
item.description: A famous index for talking about compound similarities is the "Tanimoto coefficient." However, there are quite a few people who just say "Tanimoto coefficient", and there is a good chance to writhe, "Isn't that enough explanation?" For example, use the following compound set The number of compounds is 10. smiles = [ 'C1=CC=C2C3CC(CNC3)CN2C1=O', 'CN1c2c(C(N(C)C1=O)=O)[nH0](CC(CO)O)c[nH0]2', 'CN1C2CC(CC1C1C2O1)OC(C(c1ccccc1)CO)=O', 'CN1C2CC(CC1C1C2O1)OC(C(c1cccnc1)CO)=O', # Similar to the compound above 'CN(C=1C(=O)N(c2ccccc2)N(C1C)C)C', 'CN(C=1C(=O)N(C2CCCCC2)N(C1C)C)C', # Similar to the compound above 'OCC1C(C(C(C(OCC2C(C(C(C(OC(c3ccccc3)C#N)O2)O)O)O)O1)O)O)O', 'OCc1ccccc1OC1C(C(C(C(CO)O1)O)O)O', 'OCc1cc(N)ccc1OC1C(C(C(C(CO)O1)O)O)O', # Similar to the compound above '[nH0]1c(OC)c2c([nH0]cc[nH0]2)[nH0]c1', ] Generate compounds with RDKit from #SMILES notation
